questions.question: Is the cake round in shape?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the cake appears circular in the edited pop-art style, indicated by the consistent curvature portrayed around its perimeter. The shape resembles a typical round cake on top of a pedestal, which matches common cake visuals and shapes, consistent with universal cake design knowledge where round shapes are predominant.

questions.question: Is there exactly one candle on top of the cake?
questions.explanation: Image B illustrates a single vertical element on top of the cake representing a candle, characterized by its slender form with the flame at the top which aligns with standard candle representations. This singular depiction, paired with common cake presentations, concludes the presence of one candle only.

questions.question: Is the cake placed on a raised stand?
questions.explanation: The cake in Image B is shown elevated above the table surface with the support of a discernible structure beneath it, identified as a stand. This elevates the cake and matches general presentation norms for cakes where stands are used for aesthetic display which illustrates the raised placement.

questions.question: Is there a vase with coral-pink fluffy flowers on the left side of the cake?
